item.title: A Honda-Nissan merger would be a sign of things to come in auto industry
Jeremy Siegel says stock sell-off is 'healthy' as cautious Fed gives investors a 'reality check'
item.description: Wharton's Jeremy Siegel expects the Fed to pare back the number of rate cuts next year, with just one or two reductions.

item.title: Putin admits Russian inflation is an 'alarming signal' and the economy is 'overheating'
item.description: Russian President Vladimir Putin on Thursday said that inflation is a problem in Russia and that the country's economy is overheating.

item.title: Buy the tech stock dip ahead of Trump rally, popular analyst says

item.description: Benioff thinks 2025 will be the year when AI starts to truly transform business and disrupt how we work.

item.title: What the top 75 college sports programs are worth
item.description: The top of the list is dominated by SEC and Big Ten schools, due largely to each conference's massive media rights deals.

item.title: The founder of a collapsed private equity giant who took $100 million from Bill and Melinda Gates was just expelled from the Giving Pledge
item.description: At its peak, Arif Naqvi’s private equity firm controlled almost $14 billion in assets.

item.title: Bank of Japan holds rates at 0.25%, yen weakens to over four-month low
item.description: The decision comes a day after the U.S. Federal Reserve cut rates by 25 basis points, bringing the federal funds rate to 4.25%-4.5%.

item.title: The big connection between the yen and tech stocks has been severed
